title: (x) UK red phone box "TELEPHONE" typeface - similar to Goldenbook {Mark O}
content:
Would be very grateful for any information about the typeface used for "Telephone" in these photos.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150217005421im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ukphone1_5831.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150217005421im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ukphone2_6103.jpg)
author: sihep

comments.content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150217005421im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ukphonefront_5750.jpg)
  
... or suggestions for something as close as possible that is available digitally.

Sorry, I don't have any info on the type/lettering. But if you're looking for something similar, consider Mark Simonson's Goldenbook, which is "based on the logotype of a literary magazine from the late 1920s" -- the same era when the red phone kiosks were introduced.

[http://www.ms-studio.com/FontSales/goldenbook.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150217005421/http:/www.ms-studio.com/FontSales/goldenbook.html "http://www.ms-studio.com/FontSales/goldenbook.html")
Great! The bold is pretty much identical. Many thanks.
